meanings.definition: Different forms of an element in the same physical state
meanings.sent1: Scientists study allotropes to understand how elements can exist in various shapes.
meanings.sent2: Carbon allotropes include diamonds, graphite, and fullerenes.
meanings.sent3: The allotropes of sulfur decided to have a party in the same physical state.
meanings.sent4: The concept of allotropes is like a box of different-shaped chocolates.
meanings.sent5: Visualizing allotropes is like imagining a group of identical twins with unique outfits.

meanings.definition: Variants of a chemical element with different physical properties
meanings.sent1: The allotropes of oxygen have distinct properties that affect their uses.
meanings.sent2: Iron allotropes exhibit varying hardness and magnetic properties.
meanings.sent3: The allotropes of carbon and their different physical properties made for an interesting chemistry lesson.
meanings.sent4: In the world of allotropes, each variant is like a different character in a play.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the differences between allotropes helps in predicting their behavior in reactions.

meanings.definition: Various forms of an element with distinct structures
meanings.sent1: Allotropes of phosphorus have unique structures that impact their reactivity.
meanings.sent2: The allotropes of sulfur exhibit different crystalline structures.
meanings.sent3: The allotropes of carbon were having a race to show off their distinct structures.
meanings.sent4: Exploring the world of allotropes is like entering a maze with multiple paths.
meanings.sent5: The distinct structures of allotropes can be compared to a collection of diverse architectural designs.
